direction.raw_text: I was born in Beaufort, North Carolina. A place where the air always smells of pine and salt and sea. The voice is gentle. Slightly Southern in inflection.   A young doctor's soothing manner. FADE IN: EXT. COASTAL NORTH CAROLINA (DECEMBER) (PRESENT) A vast view of the coastline in winter -- beaches, rivers, sea marshes, inlets -- ebbing and flowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For many, days and nights are spent fishing Pamlico Sound or crabbing the Neuse River. The CAMERA FINDS a small coastal town, edged by a harbor on which fishermen toil. EXT. BEAUFORT, NORTH CAROLINA - MORNING (DECEMBER) The CAMERA, MOVING inland, CROSSES OVER modest houses decked with plastic rooftop Santas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While the ocean may be the focus of daily labor, churches have always tried to be the focus of life. And MOVES UPHILL TO... EXT. MAIN STREET Where fake snow is sprayed on store windows. The CAMERA CONTINUES TO the far side of Main Street -- with its stately homes with big lawns, flower beds, and tasteful Christmas garlands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I lived here, there were eighteen churches within town limits alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. FOUR-WAY STOP From each corner, four churches face each other. The Fellowship Hall Christian Church, the Church of the Forgiven People, the Church of Sunday Atonement, and All Saints Church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sponsored pancake breakfasts, rummage sales, car washes, and softball games. EXT. LANDON'S TRUCK - TRAVELING The CAMERA FINDS and FOLLOWS a newish sport utility vehicle with MD plates as it passes a rummage sale and a softball game.

direction.raw_text: You'd think that all the people here were friendly, welcoming, open-hearted... Dr. LANDON CARTER, 33, drives the truck. INT. CAR - TRAVELING Landon looks urban, prosperous, well-groomed -- but retains his boyish whimsy and sense of irony. A cell phone and overnight bag on the seat next to him.

direction.raw_text: ... and that money or family background or education or luck didn't matter. Landon reaches out to adjust his side mirror, revealing a simple gold wedding band on his left hand. dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BEAUFORT HIGH GYM - NIGHT (NOVEMBER, 1985) ROCK MUSIC drifts out open doors -- barely recognizable as "Born in the U.S.A." Students hang. Brains, preps, richies, heavy metals, jocks, punk rockers, goths, geeks. Mixing without mixing. Most are red-eyed, woozy, wasted. A couple of boys break dance to a BOOM BOX. Missing are the criminals... A shiny T-top CAMARO ROARS up. Stops, TIRES SQUEALING. VAN HALEN BLASTING. LANDON, 18, at the wheel. He is impulsive, sexy-troubled, with the nothing-to-lose courage to act on destructive whims. He is envied, copied, feared. INT. CAMARO EMPTIES roll and CLINK on the floor. A tiny plastic skeleton dances as it hangs from the rearview mirror. Landon stamps a joint into the ashtray.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knew what I was there for and they knew it, too!' BACK OF AUDITORIUM - LATER Dr. Carter hangs on every word. Others sit on the edge of their seats. Even Clay, Eric, and Belinda. Belinda leans forward to take a photo.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted this to be a date. She watches Landon, happy, then perplexed. JAMIE'S POV Landon wolfing down his food. BACK TO SCENE JAMIE Is there a rush?

direction.raw_text: I have to get you home by one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only 7:30.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going somewhere. After. And no. I didn't ask your father. INT. YUGO - TRAVELING - NIGHT Landon drives. The CARS' "Tonight She Comes" PLAYS.   He belches loudly, dramatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your turn. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you want to. She grins.    And tries.   A small burp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring the air all the way up from your stomach. He belches again.    Just as loud.   She tries again, laughing. EXT. YUGO Landon steers the car into a parking lot for a miniature golf course with a castle-shaped video arcade and Little League diamond. A family entertainment center. INT. YUGO Jamie sees where they are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're doing something -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we do this, I just want to say that a good life's gotta be about more than achieving stuff -- like on your list. She waits for more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about working with what you already have -- right now -- at your fingertips -- you know, spontaneously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That little bit of larceny in your heart. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fun. INT. BATTING CAGE - NIGHT Jamie's in the cage with a helmet on.    A machine tosses balls. Landon coaches from outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swing! Keep your bat parallel to the ground. Follow through. Follow through! Jamie is laughing too hard to hit anything. The balls keep coming. She ducks out of the way and grasps the fence and leans in. Landon leans in on his side. They'd be embracing if the fence weren't there. In the b.g., kids from their school.    Giggling, whispering. Landon looks over at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. EXT. HIGHWAY - TRAVELING - NIGHT The YUGO ROARS down the asphalt.    A sign for the approaching state line whips by. INT. YUGO - TRAVELING - NIGHT Jamie and Landon.    With STEVIE NICKS' "Talk to Me" ON the RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cells in our bodies are always changing. In six or seven years all your cells have changed. You could be like a completely new person from the inside out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That what's happening to you, only faster? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He grins.    Pulls the car over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out.   Come on. He leaps out, leaving the headlights on. EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - NIGHT Landon takes Jamie's hand and pulls her toward some invisible place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where -- what -- are we -- ? He keeps tugging her.     She follows him.   Laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? He leans down and lifts one of her feet a foot from the other. He notices a large bruise on her leg. She brushes her dress down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're acting like a crazy person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're straddling the state line. You're in two places at once. She's thrilled at his solution to her wish.       He walks to the shoulder of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Repeat after me. Huh?   He does a cartwheel.    She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna teach you. EXT. BEACH (NEUSE RIVER) - LATE NIGHT A starry night with a bright moon. Glimmering silver water. Jamie and Landon walk onto a dock. DISTANT FIREWORKS BOOM. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's places like this that make me certain there's a God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sometimes not sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure.    Pretty sure. They reach the end of the dock. She turns to face the WIND. It blows her hair. She turns his face the same way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like the wind. I can't see it but I feel it. He closes his eyes.       Feeling the wind.   Opens them again, rejecting the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can measure wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncertainty makes you uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you actually know with religion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonder.     Beauty. Joy. (beat, quieter) Love. She's embarrassed.       She tries to avoid implying anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother told me God is love, so when you're feeling love, you're feeling God. (beat) I think talking about these things
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: threatens their very beauty and mystery. Her tone is matter-of-fact, but Landon's got a serious and tender look on his face. He touches her hair. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you're not supposed to. He moves closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I might kiss you. She looks down.    Shy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I might do it wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not possible. He touches her neck, her cheek, her mouth. Then leans in and kisses her. A tender, soft kiss. He pulls away. They look at each other a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, Jamie. There, he put it out there, risked looking and feeling foolish. Not the old Landon. Jamie looks away. Mixed emotions. Happy and sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now's when you say something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't. (beat) I can't -- explain. She turns back to him, her eyes shining.     She touches his face and they kiss again, deeply. But after a few moments, she drops her chin onto his shoulder. Smiling, glowing even, but slightly aloof, staring at the water. He pulls away slightly to study her face. He touches her cheek and brings her back from wherever she's been.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make me feel... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That.    And less strange. Tears run down her cheeks. Landon wipes them away with his thumbs, attributing them to happiness. EXT. PARSONAGE - FRONT PORCH - LATER Landon follows Jamie up the steps. The lights in the living room are on. THROUGH the windows, they can see her father taking down the Christmas tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be very quiet. He pulls her to him.      Kisses her.     The front door opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Landon. Landon and Jamie separate, but Landon keeps an arm over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Reverend. Reverend Sullivan studies the two young people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy New Year. And he goes. Jamie walks by her father and into the house. Not saying anything. He watches her. What has he allowed? EXT. BEAUFORT HIGH - COURTYARD - DAY Landon and Jamie head into school.        Landon nods to Belinda, others. They glare back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your damage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CORRIDOR - MOMENTS LATER Landon and Jamie arrive at his locker.    It's been kicked in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assholes.     This happen to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twice a year. Bang, bang, bang. Landon kicks in every locker in his row. A dozen in all. Jamie watches, a little frightened by his anger. But then he turns to her and grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now they all match. INT. CAFETERIA - NOON Landon eats alone, ignored by Eric and Clay. Jamie approaches with her tray, red-faced, tearful. She hesitates about sitting -- feeling bad that Landon's being diminished, ostracized. She thinks he doesn't see her. But as she turns to leave, he pulls a chair out for her and smiles. She sits. Landon sees her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wr--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (choked up) The Challenger exploded. Principal Kelly's about to make an announcement. The PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM CRACKLES.    Landon takes Jamie's hand as the room hushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Away from here. EXT. FIRE TOWER (CONSERVATION LAND) - STAIRS - HOUR LATER Landon leads Jamie up, round and round, to the top of the tall steel tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. TOP OF TOWER - VIEWING AREA They exit the staircase to a small 360 degree overlook. Jamie's amazed at the view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before the divorce. My father used to take me here. Fire spotting was his summer job. They look off to the curve of the horizon, where sea meets sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From here he proved to me the earth isn't flat. (beat) On rainy days, we'd be above the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you do up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look.   Talk.   Not talk. He pulls a deck of cards from his jacket pocket. They sit and he starts to shuffle. Not too well. Jamie takes the deck. Shuffles like a card shark. EXT. CEMETERY - REAR GATE - NIGHT (FEW DAYS LATER) Jamie is already waiting when Landon's Yugo pulls up.       He gets out, walks to her, they kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you tell your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truth.   I just left you out of it. She climbs up and over the wall.      He follows. EXT. INSIDE CEMETERY - MINUTES LATER Jamie fits the pieces of her telescope together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you build this? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was twelve. Landon shakes his head, amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that complicated. Landon doubts this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an alt-azimuth design with one parabolic mirror and one secondary flat one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the one you're building?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In my back yard. (pause, embarrassed) I lied before. It's hardly started. But when it's done, it will have twice the power of this one -- LANDON Wait, back up.     You lied?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kinda.   Yeah. He grins, loving her even more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do you want to see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mars doesn't rise until 2:30 A.M. -- He opens his backpack.        Pulls out the contents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thermos of hot coffee.       A blanket. Socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You planned this -- (CONTINUED) 78. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hoped for it. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you trying to seduce me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   Why?   Are you seducible?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I thought. He reaches back into his backpack.      Pulls out a second blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ergo, a second blanket.   One for me, one for you. He hands her one.     She takes it, smiling, reassured.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ergo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm always home by midnight and he's always asleep. INT. PARSONAGE - REVEREND SULLIVAN'S BEDROOM - MIDNIGHT Reverend Sullivan sits up in bed.      His feet find slippers on the floor. INT. JAMIE'S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Reverend Sullivan, wearing a robe, enters quietly. Checking on his daughter. Her bed is empty. EXT. STREET TO ACCESS ROAD - LATER The old Pontiac slows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. OLD PONTIAC Reverend Sullivan looks down the access road to the rear cemetery gate. REVEREND'S POV The Yugo parked by the gate. BACK TO SCENE The Reverend struggles with what to do. After a moment, he decides not to interfere; he'll pick his moment. He keeps driving. INT. CEMETERY Jamie and Landon are looking at the heavens through the telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Pluto?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Virgo, but it's about 1000 times too faint to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the best thing I can see tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me. He draws her close, they kiss. She shyly pulls away. Their hands still touching until she looks again into the telescope eyepiece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The second best thing is Jupiter. She swivels the telescope into position for Jupiter and steps aside so he can look. But he picks up the flashlight, pulls a diagram from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you locate XXI5639I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. She takes the diagram, studies it, and adjusts the scope. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here.   Why am I looking at this star?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I had it named for you.     I know it's not an official designation -- She couldn't be happier.     She reaches for his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's wonderful. I love you. It's the first time he's heard it. He pulls her into his arms. They kiss. Passionately. She starts to object.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   I'm stopping. And he does.    They snuggle.   Silence, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's number one? Long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In April when the dogwoods and wisteria are blooming... Get married. He doesn't make fun.     He strokes her hair.    Kisses her forehead. INT. KITCHEN - 5 AM Landon enters from outside. Cynthia, still in her waitress uniform, is sitting at the table, drinking coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A late night or an early morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Late night. (smart-aleck) You? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you with Jamie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sleeping with her? Landon doesn't dignify this question with an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was cleaning yesterday.   I found this. She pulls Landon's Life List from her pocket.      Landon is horrified. She reads it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scuba dive. Touch a moon rock. Learn to read Egyptian hieroglyphs. Go to college? (pause) She talking to you 'bout this stuff? Landon doesn't answer. She puts the list on the table. Smoothes it. Gently discouraging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, some of this is... farfetched. You take after me. People skills and common sense. Good dependable qualities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could take after Dad, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do. You're handsome and charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I meant he's a doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's eight years of school and training -- after college. And all that doesn't necessarily make you a better human being.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could do it if I tried.   Even Kelly thinks so. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'd be something. She doesn't want to discourage him, but she wants him to be practical and realistic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if it doesn't happen, grab for something within reach. Life's tough enough without causing yourself disappointment -- LANDON (angry now) Whatever my life is, I'm going to be friggin' sure I'm never disappointed -- CYNTHIA (honest) Disappointment isn't something anyone plans for. (quieter) It catches you by surprise. Long pause.    They are both sorry to have raised their voices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have I told you how proud I am of you -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, great. But what I want is for me to be proud of me. INT. PARSONAGE - SULLIVAN DINING ROOM - EVENING Landon eats dinner with Jamie and Reverend Sullivan. Silence, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon.   You're not the quiet type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So talk to us about something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what, sir? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You decide. Landon searches his mind for just the right subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about your family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Sure. (beat) My grandfather. When he was seven, he shook the hand of an old guy, a war vet or something, who had once shaken President Lincoln's hand. (pause) Made a big impression on him. Reverend Sullivan looks at his daughter.       She's nodding, interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My cousin Mike. He's from a big family. He's the fifth kid. He heard that every fifth child in the world is Chinese. So he thought he was. Jamie smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't tell him any different for years -- REV. SULLIVAN (getting to the point) Your parents are divorced?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since I was five. My mom's a cocktail waitress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you -- the two of you -- get by?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Materially or spiritually?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either. Both. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. We used to try to believe in each other. His eyes meet the Reverend's.      The Reverend's got to respect him some. INT. SULLIVAN KITCHEN - NIGHT Reverend Sullivan looks out the window into the back yard. HIS POV Jamie showing Landon the junk pile that will become her newer, larger telescope. They are laughing, jostling each other, comfortable, happy. INT. PARSONAGE - SULLIVAN KITCHEN - LATER THAT NIGHT Reverend Sullivan and Jamie put the dishes away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and the Carter boy. Want to catch me up on recent developments?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're asking if we're involved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm asking how much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad -- REV. SULLIVAN It's time to tell him. (pause) It would be the right thing. She turns to him, upset.    Her anger spilling out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. But that's not the real reason. You think if I tell, he'll disappear and that's what you want! Me all to yourself! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I want what's best for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This -- him -- Landon -- is what's best for me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sure?    You're sure you can trust him? He's playing to her old insecurities.      She's not one hundred percent sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it better to know? Their eyes meet.     She knows he's right. EXT. MOVIE THEATER - EVENING (EARLY FEBRUARY) Ferris Bueller's Day Off and Three Amigos! on the marquee. Landon and Jamie exit as Belinda and a new boyfriend buy tickets. Clay and Eric and a crowd behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Belinda. She takes her boyfriend's arm, turns away, snubbing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay, Eric. Eric says something inaudible and the whole crowd sniggers and laughs. He's become Landon. Landon reddens, now realizing for certain that he's become a Jamie Sullivan. EXT. SIDEWALK (DOWNTOWN BEAUFORT) - MOMENTS LATER Landon and Jamie walk.       The theater in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From citizen high to citizen low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Care, but just don't let it get to you. It gives them power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That what you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   I try to keep my power. He's impressed with how she manages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of your secrets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, one of many. He doesn't notice her tone. INT. YUGO - TRAVELING - NIGHT WHITNEY HOUSTON's "How Will I Know?" ON the RADIO. Jamie flips the RADIO OFF. She's got something on her mind. Landon notices only that she seems a bit remote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're worried about your college applications.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not applying to college.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you said -- JAMIE No, you assumed. He looks at her, questioning.       She's looking out her window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to take a year off? Join the Peace Corps -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to -- ? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?   Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull over.   Now. Please. Tears are running down her face.        He pulls the car over. EXT. WOODS BY SIDE OF ROAD - MOMENTS LATER Jamie gets out of the car.       Landon quickly follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie -- JAMIE I'm sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll take you home.      You'll feel better tomorrow. He tries to take her arm. She shakes off his hand, steps back. Wanting to be heard and understood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon. I'm sick -- with leukemia. Landon tries to say something.         Nothing comes out.   His soul numb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found out last winter. I'm not responding to treatment anymore. His face crumples with pain and anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctors said to do everything the same as long as possible. (pause) I didn't want anyone being -- weird around me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Including me?! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Especially you. (long beat) God gives me an illness, then you. A cruel joke. She gets in the car. Slams her door shut.       He stands there, not knowing what to do. EXT. YUGO - TRAVELING - LATER Landon pulls up in front of Jamie's house.      A long quiet ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not letting you die. Jamie just looks at him.    Feeling sorry for him -- what he wants doesn't matter. INT. SULLIVAN KITCHEN - LATE NIGHT The Reverend and Landon drink coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's her decision and she's decided not to tell people -- at least for now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How -- how long does she have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two, three months. Maybe less. Maybe more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you've given up. Reverend Sullivan hears the challenge in his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her doctors have. Jamie and I. We're still praying for a miracle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon. We've lived with this for over a year now and -- (CONTINUED) 89. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is a God, how could he let this happen??!! It's a long answer and by the time the Reverend opens his mouth to explain, Landon's out the door. EXT. HIGHWAY - NIGHT Moonless dark. Few cars. The YUGO RIPS down the road. Landon opens a map over the steering wheel. Turns on the dome light. Looks at the return address on an old letter. EXT. CITY STREETS (RALEIGH) - 3 A.M. Landon's Yugo winds through city streets. EXT. RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOOD (RALEIGH) - MINUTES LATER Mansions. Big lawns. The Yugo slows as Landon leans forward to read a street sign. His face is tear-streaked. He flicks his headlights to bright, then low again. The car turns left. EXT. DR. CARTER'S HOME - MINUTE LATER Large new colonial. Landon slams his car door and stands in the street. Staring at his father's house. He heads up a flagstone path for the front door. EXT. FRONT DOOR - MOMENTS LATER Landon RINGS the resounding DING-DONG BELL, then bangs on the heavy wood door. Grief-stricken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Carter!... Carter!... Dad! Please!! I have to talk to you!! INT. DR. CARTER'S HOME Elegant, thick carpets. Dr. Carter, putting on his robe, parts the silk drapes in the upstairs hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DR. CARTER'S POV His son standing on the front lawn.     Distraught, tearful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the door!     Please!! EXT. DR. CARTER'S HOME Landon backs away from the house. Angrily kicks over a decorative planter. Is halfway to his car when Dr. Carter opens the door and comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon! Landon doesn't hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon!! Landon turns around. Sees his father. Breaks down, sobbing. His father goes to him. Hugs him, a big bear hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to save her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon, who?   Is your mother all right? Lights pop upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Jamie -- my girlfriend -- she has cancer -- you have to come look at her -- right now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calm, trying to diffuse) It's the middle of the night -- LANDON I don't give a shit what time it is! Landon pulls away.   Angrier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon, I'm a cardiologist, not an oncologist -- (CONTINUED) 91. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a doctor, aren't you?!! He waves his father off, dismissing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon!   I'll look into it!! But Landon hasn't heard. He's in his car. Dr. Carter watches his son's car move away, regretful. INT. CARTER KITCHEN - DAWN Landon quietly shuts the back door.        Exhausted.   Starts making coffee. Cynthia appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father called. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie's a patient at his hospital. He's having a colleague look at her chart this morning. Long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.   I didn't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know either. EXT. PARSONAGE - EARLY MORNING The Yugo parked in the driveway. The morning paper lying on the grass. Landon paces in front of the front porch. Incapable of ringing the bell, lacking the courage, lacking the right words. Upstairs, the curtains move. INT. JAMIE'S BEDROOM Jamie looks out the window. JAMIE'S POV Landon pacing, talking to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACK TO SCENE She starts to raise the window, to say something, to help him, but then lets the curtain drop. She needs for him to decide, for him to be ready to face this with her. The sound of a CAR.   She looks out the window again. JAMIE'S POV The Yugo driving away. INT. LANDON'S BEDROOM - LATER THAT DAY Landon lies on his bed in the dark. The PHONE RINGS. Landon stares at his extension. The RINGING STOPS. A voice from downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your father. Landon picks up his phone. INT. UPSTAIRS HALL - TWO MINUTES LATER The door to Landon's room is ajar. Cynthia waits outside. Listening. Hearing nothing. She pushes the door open. CYNTHIA'S POV Landon sitting on his bed.   Deflated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't do anything. BACK TO SCENE Cynthia is pained to see his suffering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's incurable -- LANDON I told him to leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon -- LANDON (re: Jamie) It was the only thing I've ever asked him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LANDON'S BEDROOM - EVENING (NEXT DAY) Landon's still in bed. Facing the wall.     Cynthia KNOCKS. Enters with a plate of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought some dinner. No response.   She leaves the tray and goes. INT. PARSONAGE - SULLIVAN KITCHEN - SAME TIME Jamie and her father eat dinner.   Jamie is red-eyed, heartbroken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not sure at all) He'll call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to think he'd changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) No you didn't. (beat) But he did change. Just not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie, you're not mad at me. You're mad at Landon -- JAMIE (furious) I am mad at you! And at Landon! And the universe! And God! (quieter) I don't even know where to put all my anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's normal. God accepts your anger. He won't punish you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By making me ill, he is punishing me! (quieter) I just don't know what for. She flees the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER ANGLE - CONTINUOUS ACTION Goes up the stairs.    Keeps going.   Up another flight to the attic. INT. PARSONAGE ATTIC - MINUTE LATER Jamie opens a closet door. Pulls out a dress, a scarf, jewelry, a worn book -- her mother's belongings. She opens the book and starts to weep. Missing her mother. FOOT OF ATTIC STAIRS Reverend Sullivan stands, looking up at the attic stairs. Frustrated, angry, worried. INT. LANDON'S BEDROOM - NEXT DAY Landon is still in bed. Cynthia enters.      Pulls back the curtains. Yanks up the shades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care if you don't leave the house. But you have to get out of bed. INT. CARTER KITCHEN - FEW MINUTES LATER Landon sits at the kitchen table.     Cynthia pours him a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and I may not be communicating very well right now. But let me be clear. Don't make this about you. It's about her. Pause.   Her words sink in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea what to say. How to act. What if I do the wrong thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gently) Be yourself and I don't think there is a wrong thing. (beat) Let Jamie take the lead. She'll let you know what she needs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. PARSONAGE - FRONT PORCH - LITTLE LATER Before Landon can ring the bell, the front door opens. The Reverend. Landon runs past him into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Jamie?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At school.    Where you should be. Oh. INT. BEAUFORT HIGH - CORRIDOR - HALF HOUR LATER Deserted, classes are meeting. Landon runs, sliding to a stop at one classroom door. Looks in, keeps going, stops at another. Searching. This is JAMIE'S POV from the top of the hallway. JAMIE She stands, holding her books, watching him, unsure. LANDON finally feels her gaze, turns to look. JAMIE turns away, still angry and disappointed. LANDON runs to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie! He catches up to her. JAMIE AND LANDON face each other.   Neither sure what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry.    I'm a coward -- (CONTINUED) 96. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should have told you sooner -- LANDON (guilt-ridden) I made you do too many things, kept you up all night -- JAMIE No. The drugs just stopped working. If anything, doing things I love kept me healthy longer. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you frightened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the time. (beat) I feel like I have no one. She means not even God and he gets this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have me. He hugs her close, rocking her, comforting her and himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me live until I die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. INT. SCHOOL AUDITORIUM - EVENING (MID-FEBRUARY) A small group of students sit on stage reading from Our Town, rehearsing. Jamie and Landon sit together in the third row, holding hands. Landon glances at her, realizes she's asleep. Pulls her sweater over her. INT. JEFFERSON HIGH - LIBRARY - SATURDAY MORNING Landon sits with Luis; Jamie at the next table with Isabel. She looks pale. He catches her eye. They both smile, a little sadly, then turn back to their students.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. YUGO - TRAVELING Landon drives them home from Jefferson High.      No music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're going to build a tunnel under the English Channel. They're calling it The Chunnel. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. He reaches into a cooler on the floor of the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slim Jim? Apple? Yogurt?     You like yogurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to like yogurt. He places a red heart-shaped box in her lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (apologetic) Not very original. Happy Valentine's Day. He grins.   She looks crestfallen, feels terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't even think about it. He takes a chocolate.     Pops it in his mouth.   Grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There.   You gave me a chocolate. LANDON'S POV (THROUGH JAMIE'S TELESCOPE) - VAST STAR FIELD PULL BACK to reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT Jamie and Landon are looking at stars.      A long quiet moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you thinking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (honest) That I want you to take me home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now?    We just -- JAMIE I don't want to come here anymore. She begins taking the telescope apart.      Depressed. EXT. CEMETERY GATE - HALF HOUR LATER Jamie looks at the high fence, weary, then reaches into a pocket for a key. Unlocks the gate. Swings the gate open. Landon's astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a key?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  I've just never needed it. (pause) Will you talk to my father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've talked to your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I mean. Their eyes meet.     Her look is serious. EXT. PARSONAGE - BACK YARD - NEXT DAY Reverend Sullivan is up a ladder. Cleaning a gutter. Landon stands below, a few feet away, gathering his nerve. He walks over. ON LADDER The Reverend is busy ignoring Landon standing below.       A long beat, then: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir. Being ignored is beginning to feel preferable to being noticed. The Reverend looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be honest. I don't know if I can pray, but I can do just about anything else. Neither Landon nor the Reverend see Jamie come out of the house and walk over. ON GROUND Landon shields his eyes with a hand to see the Reverend better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you need. Whatever Jamie needs. I'm here. (beat) I could start by driving her to school -- JAMIE I'm not going back to school. Landon and her father both turn to her.      Pale, wane.   They understand what she is saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can tell anyone you want.   I don't care. She goes into the house. Landon and Reverend Sullivan look at each other, then away, uncomfortable. That didn't sound like her. INT. BEAUFORT HIGH - HALLWAY - MONDAY MORNING Landon, looking haggard, moves slowly as he cleans out Jamie's locker. Students stare as he carefully places her things, including the pink sweater, in a shopping bag. They part and hush as he passes by. News travels fast. Clay and Eric step forward. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.   Landon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We heard 'bout Jamie Sullivan. She -- LANDON (fierce) Say nothing. Nothing 'bout her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.    Hey. We're sorry, man! Landon turns back. Surprised.        Inspects Belinda.   Eric. Clay. Others. No one speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late and not enough. He pushes past Belinda's new boyfriend, heading for the office. INT. PRINCIPAL KELLY'S OFFICE - DAY Mr. Kelly and Landon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it means not graduating, but I need to be excused from all school acti--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're excused. Landon heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is she? Landon can't answer.       Too emotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will graduate. Landon looks up, astounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I have to tutor you myself. Landon nods, accepting, appreciative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. JAMIE'S BEDROOM - LATER Landon puts away the contents of the shopping bag. Jamie's in bed, wearing the sweater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yesterday I felt sick, horrible. Today I feel like riding my bike. Or dancing. He turns on the CLOCK RADIO next to her bed. Finds a WALTZ. Offers his hand. Pulls her out of bed. She's in pajamas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how to waltz??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bashful) I was going to fake it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always fake it. So they waltz, faking, stumbling and laughing, holding each other. INT. PARSONAGE - STAIRCASE - SAME TIME Reverend Sullivan hears the MUSIC and LAUGHTER.   He frowns, afraid for Jamie's health. INT. JAMIE'S BEDROOM Jamie grips Landon's arms, seems to slip, suddenly too exhausted to carry her weight. Landon picks her up, gently carries her back to bed. Settles her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (murmurs) Tired. Landon sits on her bed. Strokes her hair. They look at each other. Landon reaches for her hand. When he looks at her face again, she's asleep. EXT. LANDON'S HOUSE - BACK YARD - ANOTHER DAY Landon's sitting on his childhood tree swing, twisting side to side. Pensive. His mother comes out of the house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time seems to be slowing down and speeding up at the same time. She reaches to put a hand on his shoulder.       He lets her. EXT. CEMETERY - EARLY MARCH The rear gate is open. A caretaker waits while Landon carries pieces of the older telescope to his car. A tall pile of parts is already at his car. Eric and Clay drive up in Eric's pickup.    Gravel flying. MUSIC BLASTING. INT. PICKUP Eric and Clay spy Landon. EXT. CEMETERY Landon freezes, not sure what to expect. EXT. PICKUP The truck makes a circle around Landon, then stops. The MUSIC QUIETS. Eric and Clay jump down. A long tense moment, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Without a word, Clay walks to the Yugo, lifts the heaviest telescope part, and carries it to the bed of the pickup. Eric follows suit. EXT. PARSONAGE - BACK YARD - LATER Landon studies the pieces of the smaller telescope and how they fit together. They are like a map for how to build the bigger one. EXT. PARSONAGE DRIVEWAY - NEXT DAY Landon unloads an impossibly large round cardboard concrete form-tube from his car. Carries it around the house toward the back yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. JAMIE'S BEDROOM - SAME TIME Jamie wakes from a nap. She looks thinner, grayer. She hears HAMMERING. She hauls herself up and to a window. JAMIE'S POV Landon working on the new telescope.    He looks up at her window. Sees her there. Smiles. BACK TO SCENE Reverend Sullivan comes in to check on Jamie.    She's standing at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that boy doing? She turns to look at him and collapses into his arms. INT. HOSPITAL - PATIENT ROOM - NIGHT Jamie lies in bed, eyes closed. Hooked to monitors, pumps, an IV drip. Landon holding her hand. Reverend Sullivan talks quietly with a doctor. Hearing bad news. EXT. HOSPITAL - DAWN The sky is pink. A squirrel runs along a telephone wire. The Yugo is the only car in the visitor lot. INT. PATIENT ROOM Landon, in yesterday's clothes, dozes lightly. Jamie moves and he starts, fully awake. She opens her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? She nods. Sleepy. Closes her eyes again. He rests his head on her shoulder and weeps. Her eyes open, then close again. There's nothing to say. INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE JAMIE'S ROOM - SAME TIME Reverend Sullivan looks through the window in the door at the scene within. He hesitates, then pushes the door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PATIENT ROOM Reverend Sullivan enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon.   You go on home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to be with her. There's only one chair.    Landon nods and goes. The Reverend sits, closes his eyes a moment.   When he opens them, she's looking at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad. He kisses her forehead, then sits back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie, God is not punishing you. No God I know wants anyone to be sick or feel pain or suffer. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Mom died you told me God wanted her more, loved her more -- REV. SULLIVAN I was wrong. Nobody could have wanted or loved your mother more than we did. Not even God. He lets this sink in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God loaned you to me, entrusted you to my care. I'm failing you. She looks away, agreeing without saying so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie. I make you the same promise that God does. (beat) I will always be with you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She sits up and embraces him. He wraps his arms around her. Tight. She closes her eyes, tears welling, never wanting to let him go. Her father. EXT. BEAUFORT HIGH SCHOOL - HOUR LATER On the marquee on the front lawn: "WELCOME HALEY'S COMET." The Yugo parks in the b.g. INT. PRINCIPAL KELLY'S OFFICE - MINUTES LATER Landon picks up a pile of books and assignments. Looks through them, then eyes Miss Tarbox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Jamie's book?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's everything Mr. Kelly gave me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next book on that list!   The Old Man and... and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   I need it today! Mr. Kelly steps out of his inner office.      Sees Landon's anguished face, his exhaustion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll drive a copy over to her. Landon nods his appreciation. INT. HOSPITAL - PATIENT ROOM - DAY Jamie looks smaller. Her eyes have blue circles beneath. The Hemingway novel on the bedstand. Belinda pushes the door open. Peeks in. Not sure she is welcome. Landon is sitting in a chair.     He sees her, motions for her to come in. Quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She asleep? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell her you were here. Pause.   Awkwardness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give her this, okay? She hands Landon a small photo album.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pictures from the play.   Jamie looks pretty -- LANDON I'm sorry about how we -- BELINDA (conciliatory) No.    You're with who you should be.    It's like she chose you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I have no idea why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. She hugs him quickly, then leaves.       Landon goes to the window, looks out. SAME SCENE - HOURS LATER The sky is grayer, darker.      Landon is still at the window. Jamie wakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. He goes to her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. He kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have something for you. She reaches under her pillow for the worn book from the attic. She offers it to Landon. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. It's not a Bible. He takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother made it for me before I was born. (beat) It's got quotes from famous people. Her favorite lines from books. Her thoughts. Landon looks at a page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.' Aristotle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lower.   Same page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Find out who you are and do it on purpose.' Dolly Parton. A bookmark falls out.     He studies that page a moment. CLOSE ON PASSAGE from Corinthians. BACK TO SCENE Landon reads it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Love is always patient and kind. It is never boastful or conceited -- ' JAMIE That was read at my parents' wedding. He takes her hand.     Holds it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How're you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better. I was really angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you have hope that you'll get better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (pause, shrugging, accepting) Maybe I believe God has a bigger dream for me than I had for myself. (beat) Maybe I believe the journey, the big adventure, never ends... He kneels on the floor.       Puts his head on her pillow next to hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I believe God sent you to me because I am ill. To help me through. He touches her face tenderly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to go home. Pause.   He gets her meaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll talk to your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that simple. (pause) It costs money to do this at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CARTER LIVING ROOM - EVENING Cynthia pacing, talking on the phone, worried.   The front door is wide open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) ... He doesn't talk to me, maybe not to anyone, except Jamie... She stands in the doorway and looks out. CYNTHIA'S POV Landon in his car in the driveway. INT. LANDON'S CAR Landon just sits.    Exhausted, despondent. INT. CARTER LIVING ROOM Cynthia pacing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) ... I've never asked you for extra. But we need it now... as soon as possible... INT. HOSPITAL - PATIENT ROOM - ANOTHER AFTERNOON Jamie's breathing is shallower. Landon's reading her The Sheltering Sky. He pauses, looks up. Isabel, Jamie's student, is standing in the doorway. Jamie sees her too. She smiles weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Isabel comes in. Landon offers her the book. She takes it and keeps going from where Landon left off. Stumbling but reading. Jamie grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's been working with you? Isabel looks shyly at Landon. Jamie shakes her head, amazed. Landon nods to Isabel and she begins reading again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CARTER BACK STEPS - THAT NIGHT Landon quietly opens the back door to the kitchen. HIS POV Cynthia sits at the table with Dr. Carter, his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit with us a minute. INT. CARTER KITCHEN Landon enters, but doesn't sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to his father) What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to his mother) Now it's okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon. You have two parents. We're both here for you even -- DR. CARTER -- even if we're not here for each other anymore. Landon is listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to do this. Please let me. He holds out a check.   For a lot of money.   Landon takes it. Grateful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly, to both parents) Thank you. INT. PARSONAGE - JAMIE'S BEDROOM - DAY A smaller Jamie lies in a hospital bed, seemingly asleep. Hooked to an IV. Bottles of pills. Landon dozes in a comfortable chair. A nurse sits in a corner, reading. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Eric and Clay stand in the doorway, not sure what to do. Jamie opens her eyes, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't wake Landon. They tiptoe in.    Stand on either side of her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look scary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not too bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right? A dumb question but she handles it well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things could be better. Awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We thought you'd be asleep -- JAMIE (trying to help) I don't know what to say either. Clay hands her an envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? She pulls out a stack of worn bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the book drive.      Landon told us about it -- ERIC We told everyone at school. Jamie takes their hands, holds them. Thanking them silently. Her eyes shining with tears. INT. LANDON'S BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT Landon sits at his desk, sketching the larger telescope, making a few computations. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: A library book on Haley's Comet is open.      A stack of similar books by his elbow. Cynthia enters wearing her waitressing outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do? He shrugs.    Tears fill his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's being done but it's not enough. I have to find something -- more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon, honey. There's nothing more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mean about Jamie being sick. I mean about Jamie and me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be with her when she wants.    Make sure she never feels alone. Landon thinks his mother is also talking about herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I'm not going anywhere.   Not yet anyway. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you are ready, I want you to feel free to go. They embrace. INT. LANDON'S BEDROOM - LATER Landon opens Jamie's mother's book.     A photo of Jamie falls out -- one taken by Belinda. CLOSE ON PHOTO Jamie, beautiful, smiling at the audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LANDON considers the photo, finds a page to tuck it into. CLOSE ON HANDWRITTEN JOTTING "For Landon" above some underlined text, a Psalm from the Bible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading aloud)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cry to you my Lord, my rock! Do not be deaf to me, for if you are silent, I shall go down to the pit like the rest. Hear my voice raised in petition as I cry to you for help, as I raise my hands, my Lord, toward your holy of holies.' Landon knows Jamie underlined this for him. INT. LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Landon tears down the steps. Past his mother to the front door. He's out the door before she even turns around. INT. PARSONAGE - REVEREND SULLIVAN'S BEDROOM - MIDNIGHT Reverend Sullivan sits up in bed. His feet find slippers on the floor. He looks haggard, his hair thinner, his face defeated. INT. JAMIE'S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER The Reverend, wearing his robe, checks on his sleeping daughter. The night nurse nods as he tucks in blankets. A SOUND. Then another. Reverend Sullivan goes to the window. Parts the drapes. Looks out. HIS POV A dozen flashlights in a big circle. Landon in the middle, working feverishly on the new telescope. EXT. BACK YARD - MOMENTS LATER The back porch light comes on. Reverend Sullivan steps out onto the back porch. Landon looks up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to finish it tonight. Without a word, the Reverend turns around and goes back inside. Leaving the porch light on. Landon goes back to work. EXT. BACK YARD - MINUTES LATER Reverend Sullivan comes out. Dressed. He carries two mugs of coffee and a brightly burning kerosene camp lantern. Peace offerings. He walks over, sets down the lantern, hands Landon a mug. Ready to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've almost finished the rocker. Did she order mirrors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In there. As they walk to the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have materials for the side bearings?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm using an old phonographic turntable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the focuser?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chrome-plated brass pipe from a drain line. The Reverend nods, impressed.    He yanks the garage door up. Goes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know about this stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I helped Jamie with the first one. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought she built it herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She did. But hardly anyone does anything truly alone. The Reverend carries out a large cardboard postal package. Landon takes it as the Reverend lowers the garage door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to do this alone. Reverend Sullivan searches Landon's face for a long moment, understanding, then turns and heads for the back door. INT. CHURCH - REVEREND'S OFFICE - NEXT MORNING Landon stands in the doorway. The Reverend is wiping his glasses, his face, maybe of tears. He sees Landon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finish?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few minutes ago. I have to ask you something. Long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was seventeen, I was sent up for a year for stealing a car. (beat) Sometimes I still feel that boy inside me and I don't like him. (beat) But I like you. The Reverend stands, offers Landon his hand.     Landon takes it. The two men shake. Allies now. INT. JAMIE'S ROOM - THAT EVENING Jamie opens her eyes. But can barely keep them open. Groggy from pain medication. Landon's standing there. Showered, clean clothes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going out. He starts helping the nurse disconnect her IV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I -- go out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be fine for a few minutes. Jamie looks at the nurse.    Uncertain.     The nurse nods. EXT. PARSONAGE ROOF - NIGHT Landon carries Jamie out a large attic window. The finished large telescope is set up. Pointing at the sky. She's in her nightgown, wrapped in a blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful... Thank you. But she looks at the lights of the house and streets around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what we'll be able to see... Help me stand. He checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a sec. As she turns to him, questioning, the neighborhood suddenly darkens as the street lamps and lights in every nearby house are switched off. EXT. DOWN STREET Neighbors step outside.    Hold up binoculars. EXT. BEAUFORT HIGH - PARKING LOT Members of the Star Club and other students look through traditional telescopes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. PARSONAGE ROOF Jamie hugs Landon in gratitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have five minutes. Jamie, tears streaming, braces herself against Landon and she peers into the telescope eyepiece. She pulls back, wipes her eyes, then looks again. She swings the telescope into the correct position. HER POV THROUGH TELESCOPE Haley's Comet, its icy nucleus issuing the jets and streamers of gas, dust, and debris that form the comet's hazy head and long tail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The comet of the century... BACK TO SCENE She steps back so he can see. He looks quickly, then moves aside so she can keep looking. She's completely engrossed. A long, quiet moment, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You love me? She leans away from the eyepiece and looks at him -- yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you do something for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon.    I can't even do for myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if you could, you would?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. His throat tightens with nervousness, with hope, fear, sadness, and love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you marry me? HER FACE Illness, happiness, disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SOUTHERN BAPTIST CHURCH - EARLY APRIL A sea of pink, purple, and white blossoms.    Dogwoods, wisteria, azaleas, and roses blooming. INT. SOUTHERN BAPTIST CHURCH Bursting with everyone who knows Jamie and Landon -- every kid in their high school, including Eric, Clay, Belinda; teachers, including Ms. Garber; Mr. Kelly; Luis and Isabel and others from Jefferson High; her father's congregation; Cynthia Carter; Dr. Carter's new wife and their two kids; neighbors; hospital staff and home nurses. Landon stands with his father by the altar. The "WEDDING MARCH" begins... The double doors at the back of the church open. Everyone turns to look at the bride. Gasps of joy and sadness. LANDON'S POV - JAMIE Flanked by a nurse and Reverend Sullivan. She's wearing her Lizzie dress from the play. It hangs loosely, but still becomes her. She's a beautiful bride. BACK TO SCENE Landon swells with pride. Jamie smiles. Then, leaning on her father, she slowly makes her way down the aisle. In the pews -- few dry eyes follow her. Jamie -- halfway -- stops to rest and catch her breath.     A moment later, she and her father continue. A long, difficult walk.    A walk to remember. AT ALTAR The nurse rolls a wheelchair up as Jamie and her father near. Applause breaks out as Jamie reaches Landon's side. Jamie sits.   Exhausted. (CONTINUED) 119. CONTINUED: Landon kneels to be the same height as Jamie in her chair. Pause.   Dr. Carter kneels.   Showing solidarity with his son. Reverend Sullivan, standing, leans down to kiss Jamie's cheek. Trying to keep his emotions in check. LANDON AND JAMIE'S POV Reverend Sullivan towering over them. BACK TO SCENE Reverend Sullivan kneels, too. Jamie takes Landon's hand in her right hand, her father's hand in her left. Linking the three together. The congregation silences. Reverend Sullivan looks up from his Bible.     Struggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a father, I'm supposed to give away my daughter. But I can no more give Jamie away than I can give away my heart. But I can let another share in the joy she has given me. May God's blessings be with you both. He reaches out, offering a hand to Landon.     Completing the circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landon, repeat after me. Do you take... As words are spoken and vows and rings exchanged, the CAMERA MOVES ACROSS the faces of those at the altar -- Jamie, Landon, Dr. Carter. TO the first row of the congregation -- Cynthia Carter, Josh, Eric, Clay. Then BACK row by row as the Reverend begins reading a passage from the book Jamie's mother made for her. His voice soft and melodious, like a poet reading his own work. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Love is always patient and kind. It is never jealous. Love is never boastful or conceited. It is never rude or selfish. It does not take offense and is not resentful. Love takes no pleasure in other people's sins, but delights in the truth. It is always ready to excuse, to trust, to hope, and to endure whatever comes...' And the CAMERA MOVES OUT the double doors to find... PARSONAGE in a different season.      Winter. UP the front steps and INTO... LIVING ROOM (PRESENT DAY) As it is now, in present day. The nurse disappears, leaving Landon Carter, 33, waiting. Looking at a framed photo of Jamie as Lizzie in The Rainmaker... The nurse returns, helping an old man as he shuffles in. Reverend Sullivan. He's stooped, thin, balding. His skin parchment thin. The two men embrace.       Stiff, uncomfortable, uncertain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting by. Pause.   Why is he here?     The Reverend waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm -- I'm returning something. He twists the ring on his finger.      Removes it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This belongs to you. He gives his wedding ring to the Reverend.          Pause.   Landon searches for something meaningful to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She taught me -- everything.     She saved my life. The Reverend turns away, overcome with sadness.         Realizing now why Landon has come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're marrying again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie wanted that. She told me. Landon is grateful to know this.       He makes a move to go. Then turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry she never got her miracle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She did.    It was you. Landon, deeply touched, embraces the old man again. Warmly, fully. Two men still grieving, saying good-bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamie once said when you're feeling love, you're also feeling God. EXT. NEUSE RIVER - THAT AFTERNOON Landon walks alone.      His hair and clothing tousled by a steady gentle wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She made me a believer. In love. In life. In the journey that never ends... Landon stops.       Faces the wind.   Lets the air swirl over him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction
